org.pojoxml.core
Interface PojoXml

public interface PojoXml

PojoXml interface is contains the method for invoking the core library functionality

pojo to xml and xml back to pojo

Since:
1.0
Author:
SreeHari

Method Detail

getXml

java.lang.String getXml(java.lang.Object pojoObject)
For generating the String from the given POJO.

Parameters:
pojoObject - POJO object for generating the xml file.
Returns:
string contains the xml content.

saveXml

void saveXml(java.lang.Object object,
             java.lang.String fileName)
Saves the generated xml file in the given path.

Parameters:
object - object for generating xml file.
fileName - name of the file to save as xml. Give name as fully qualified. for example C:\temp\file.xml

getPojo

java.lang.Object getPojo(java.lang.String xmlContent,
                         java.lang.Class objectClass)
Gives the POJO from the given xml file.

Parameters:
xmlContent - contains xml data to be converted as POJO.
objectClass - is to generate POJO class.
Returns:
POJO object.

getPojoFromFile

java.lang.Object getPojoFromFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                                 java.lang.Class objectClass)
Generating POJO object from given xml file path.

Parameters:
fileName - full path name of xml file.
objectClass - for making POJO object from given file.
Returns:
POJO object.

setEncoding

void setEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
Adding encoding for the xml header for example UTF-8

Parameters:
encoding - character encoding default is UTF-8

enableCDATA

void enableCDATA(boolean enableCDATA)
indicator for adding CDATA to all string type values

Parameters:
enableCDATA - true means enable false means disable default false

addCollectionClass

void addCollectionClass(java.lang.String elementName,
                        java.lang.Class clas)
Adding the class type for identifying the type of object contained in the collection. So that PojoXml creates a new instance of given class and set values to it. and add it to collection

Parameters:
elementName - actual element name presented inside the collection
clas - class Type for the object inside the collection
Throws:
PojoXmlException - if the given class is null

addFieldAlias

void addFieldAlias(java.lang.Class cls,
                   java.lang.String fieldName,
                   java.lang.String aliasName)
Used for giving alias names to variables defined in the POJO object.

Parameters:
cls - POJO class Type
fieldName - actual variable name
aliasName - alias name for the variable
Throws:
PojoXmlException - if the given class is null

addClassAlias

void addClassAlias(java.lang.Class cls,
                   java.lang.String aliasName)
Add alias name for the root class.

Parameters:
cls - POJO clas Type
aliasName - alias name for the class
Throws:
PojoXmlException - if the given class is null
